docs.snippet: A two-pronged strategy contained in the state budget seeks to minimize the impact of the new federal cap on deductions of state and local taxes.

docs.snippet: Japanese business sentiment worsened for the first time in two years in the three months to March, a closely watched central bank survey showed on Monday, as rising raw materials and labour costs weigh on an otherwise steady economic recovery.

headline.main: Japan's Business Mood Sours for First Time in Two Years, Upbeat on Capex

docs.snippet: China hit back quickly on Wednesday against the Trump administration's plans to impose tariffs on $50 billion in Chinese goods, retaliating with a list of similar duties on key U.S. imports including soybeans, planes, cars, beef and chemicals.

headline.main: China Retaliates, Slaps Duties on U.S. Soybeans, Planes; Markets Skid
